title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 June 2015 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit  
02:07 <abusenius> has quit  
06:01 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
06:37 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:21 <mflorea> has quit  
08:00 <cjd> has quit  
08:38 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <polx> has quit  
08:57 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <polx> has quit  
09:31 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
09:31 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <lucaa> has quit  
10:05 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
10:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <cjd> has quit  
10:40 <martinus\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <martinus\_\_> hi tmortagne , vmassol : do you know  if it's possible to change xwiki.plugin.image.defaultQuality directly from the XWiki UI ?  
10:43 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: from what I see in the code it's only searched in xwiki.cfg  
10:44 <tmortagne> so I guess not  
10:45 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: talking about http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+to+improve+the+avatar+image+quality ?  
10:45 <vmassol> so indeed there's no UI for it ATM  
10:46 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, yes  
10:46 <tmortagne> UI or not it does not even seems to be possible to modify it at runtime anyway  
10:46 <vmassol> (it could be added)  
10:48 <tmortagne> actually there is one way but only in the URL  
10:48 <tmortagne> you can change the quality using ?quality=1.0  
10:48 <tmortagne> in the image download URL  
10:48 <tmortagne> but no general configuration  
10:55 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne,  but it's not especially linked to avatars in our case. It's any image that you attach in Xwiki then you reference it in a doc changing the width  
10:56 <martinus\_\_> it's always a bit annoying to have to restart XWiki for such a small thing :) I'm going to open a request ;)  
10:57 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, my previous messages was for you too.  
10:58 <vmassol> it's a general config that is not supposed to change  
10:58 <vmassol> so I don't see why it would be annoying  
10:58 <vmassol> you configure it once only  
10:58 <vmassol> (martinus\_\_)  
10:58 <tmortagne> it's not usually the kind of thing you change often  
10:59 <martinus\_\_> but you may have to change it per wiki for example  
10:59 <vmassol> that's different  
10:59 <vmassol> right now this is a global setting for your xwiki instance  
10:59 <vmassol> I'm not sure the per wiki UC is valid, you'd need to explain why you need different quality on different wikis, I don't see why  
11:00 <martinus\_\_> the thing is, why an admin would need access to the xwiki.cfg and permission to restart the container for such a basic thing ?  
11:00 <vmassol> errr?  
11:00 <vmassol> 1) it's not basic  
11:00 <vmassol> 2) it's no more basic that hundreds of other config options there in xwiki.cfg  
11:01 <vmassol> if your point is that all config options in xwii.cfg should be able to be modified at runtime it's another matter which is valid  
11:01 <martinus\_\_> it's basic because if affect image quality in web pages. so it's content. And the default setting is pretty low. maybe ol-ow2 can show an example ?  
11:01 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, of course I'm pointing this too  
11:02 <vmassol> if the default is too low then it's yet another issue!  
11:02 <ol-ow2> http://www.ow2.org/bin/view/Events2015ProgrammingContest/ right panel for example (hi vmassol)  
11:02 <vmassol> there's no magic though  
11:02 <tmortagne> there is an issue about the way the resize is implemented that could be improved a lot actually which would be the best first step IMO  
11:02 <vmassol> if you need quality you should provide cropped images :)  
11:03 <ol-ow2> http://www.ow2.org/bin/download/Panels/Topics2014ProgrammingContest/BUAAlogo.jpg original image  
11:03 <martinus\_\_> but the "too low" depending on a subjective criteria  
11:03 <vmassol> that's what would give the best  
11:03 <vmassol> I mean, as thomas says we can improve the algoirthm  
11:04 <vmassol> but it'll never be as good as an unresized image  
11:04 <vmassol> (obviously :))  
11:04 <vmassol> we already have a jira issue on the quality  
11:04 <vmassol> (btw)  
11:04 <tmortagne> note that according to the jira issue the current implementation is really really bad and using the suggested lib would probably already improve it a lot with the current quality setting  
11:05 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7623  
11:05 <tmortagne> right now even with best quality you can end up with bad result  
11:05 <gsmeria> has quit  
11:05 <tmortagne> I even disabled it in some wiki when people was using big images for profiles  
11:05 <tmortagne> s/when/where/  
11:06 <martinus\_\_> okay so it's more a bad implementation issue than any points i've raised  
11:06 <vmassol> so I guess XWIKI-7623 is what martinus\_\_would like fixed  
11:07 <martinus\_\_> yes. And anyway , in some CMS you can for example set quality parameters for imageMagick from the UI. Which sounds proper from a webmaster point of view (or he should ask the admin, that might be overloaded which is still another issue of course)  
11:08 <martinus\_\_> but I guess you got my point her :)  
11:09 <martinus\_\_> because restarting a farm that contain 15+ websites just for can be annoying I can assure  
11:13 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:18 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, " it's no more basic that hundreds of other config options there in xwiki.cfg"  do you really thing this ?  I see a difference between 'xwiki.store.migration.databases' , and 'xwiki.plugin.image.defaultQuality'. The first has no reason to be changed at runtime for ex (that's not what I call a 'basic' thing). The second could be and a webmaster could benefit without the help of the admin  
11:19 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: sure, anyway any parameter that make sense at runtime is always an improvement (when to put it in the UI is another matter)  
11:19 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: for me the image quality is not something to be changed at runtime but it could be  
11:19 <tmortagne> s/when/where/  
11:19 <vmassol> \*could be argued  
11:20 <tmortagne> having the possibility to set it at runtime will not cause issues so it's ok to be able to do that technically, the only issue then is crowded configuration UI  
11:20 <cjd> [[Some\_Argue]]  
11:21 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, let's say, to prevent a container stop/start :) It's always good not to have to restart the whole engine isn't it ?  
11:21 <vmassol> the same could be said for the list of rendering transformations to execute for ex  
11:21 <vmassol> (and for a lot of others)  
11:21 <vmassol> since wiki admins could want to enable/disabme emoticons for example  
11:21 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: sure  
11:22 <cjd> I'm surprised that browsers have not begun to inform servers via a little header that they plan to show $image with $width/$height  
11:22 <vmassol> I was replyong to your comment saying it was a pain  
11:22 <vmassol> it's a one time pain  
11:22 <vmassol> which is acceptable IMO  
11:22 <vmassol> it doesn't mean we shouldn't try to improve it ;)  
11:22 <martinus\_\_> yes but there might have several one-time-pain lol  
11:23 <vmassol> said differently I didn't consider it a top priority compared to lots of otehr issues :)  
11:23 <vmassol> but if you provide a patch then it's another matter! :)  
11:24 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, absolutely I agree. It's more a general issue with configuration things that needs a restart.  
11:24 <vmassol> yup  
11:25 <martinus\_\_> ol-ow2, do you need something else configured in xwiki.cfg so I can restart the container ? \*lol\*  
11:25 <martinus\_\_> joking of course  
11:26 <ol-ow2> :)  
11:26 <vmassol> :)  
11:26 <martinus\_\_> we'll see this at next upgrade :)))  
11:27 <cjd> oh the age-old problem of changing config files "to take effect on next restart"  
11:27 <vmassol> btw  
11:27 <vmassol> this is a problem because it's some old style plugin config  
11:28 <vmassol> since we moved to component and ConfigurationSource we make sure that all config for which it makes sense can be modified at runtime  
11:28 <vmassol> so even if there's not always a UI they can still be configured in xwikipreferences docs  
11:29 <vmassol> (or specific config docs)  
11:29 <martinus\_\_> yes. good start  
11:31 <martinus\_\_> about the resize implementation , https://code.google.com/p/thumbnailator/ seems to be rather "active"  
11:31 <martinus\_\_> but still "Thumbnailator is still early in its development"  
11:33 <vmassol> well looks slightly dead to me  
11:33 <vmassol> https://code.google.com/p/thumbnailator/source/list  
11:33 <vmassol> :)  
11:33 <vmassol> for 0.x version it's not very encourging  
11:33 <cjd> what version is it ?  
11:34 <vmassol> 0.4.8  
11:34 <cjd> hmm  
11:34 <vmassol> I would expect a lib at that version to be more active  
11:34 <cjd> some people are very conservitive and use like 0.24.6 and so on because they don't want to say "1.0"  
11:34 <vmassol> or they should name it 1.0!  
11:34 <martinus\_\_> what about using java interface do imagemagick ?  
11:34 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:34 <martinus\_\_> s/do/to  
11:35 <vmassol> we just need an xwiki interface to resize  
11:35 <vmassol> and then we can swap any impl in the future  
11:36 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, I'm not sure if what I'm saying about IM is relevant. I only read that there is a java interface to it  
11:36 <vmassol> ok  
11:36 <vmassol> no idea, haven't researched  
11:36 <vmassol> but an interface provides the freedom to use whatever we want  
11:36 <martinus\_\_> I add the link to the mentioned xwiki issue, we never know  
11:37 <vmassol> ok thanks  
11:39 <martinus\_\_> ol-ow2, so you read that ? do some crops and don't bother the admin anymore please :D :D  
11:40 <ol-ow2> yeah great  
11:42 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:43 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:04 <tmortagne> mflorea: does it means that every single extension that were using require.js and $services.webjars.url are broken ? from what I understand you had to put .js and not you have to remove it  
12:04 <tmortagne> s/not/now/  
12:05 <mflorea> yes, almost all extensions, see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki71M1#HLoadingJavaScriptfromWebJarswithRequireJS  
12:05 <tmortagne> vmassol: talking about XWIKI-10881  
12:05 <tmortagne> I don't think this is acceptable  
12:05 <mflorea> unless the js code is evaluated, in which case you need to put the .js extension  
12:07 <tmortagne> vmassol: this issue broke all extension that were using webjars, we need to do something better  
12:07 <mflorea> I don't see what we can do  
12:08 <mflorea> maybe overwrite the require function and make it check if the .js extension is specified  
12:08 <tmortagne> well the webjar resource try with and without the .js, it's not much  
12:08 <tmortagne> s/try/could try/  
12:09 <tmortagne> what is sure is that we can't stay like this  
12:09 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
12:10 <mflorea> actually there is a 'noext' plugin for requirejs that prevents it from adding the '.js' extension  
12:11 <vmassol> back  
12:11 <vmassol> i don't remember removing js at the end or anytihng like this  
12:11 <mflorea> but the default code we have in platform has been already changed to not put the extenbsion  
12:11 <vmassol> I think Marius made some changes though  
12:11 <mflorea> :)  
12:11 <vmassol> but I don't recall the details  
12:12 <vmassol> my goal for XWIKI-10881 was never to change the extension at the end  
12:13 <mflorea> requirejs adds the extension if the URL is relative and doesn't have a query string. Before XWIKI-10881 the webjar URLs had a query string so requirejs did not add the extension. Now it adds it  
12:13 <vmassol> it was just to change the url path format and using $services.url() shoul protect you normally  
12:13 <vmassol> ok I see  
12:13 <mflorea> by changing the URL (move the path from query string) we changed the behaviour  
12:13 <tmortagne> $services.url() does not decide of the file name  
12:13 <vmassol> so we could add a query string?  
12:14 <mflorea> a fake one? yes, but it's kind of hackish  
12:14 <vmassol> @marius: didn'r you do some change for this?  
12:14 <vmassol> you or guilluame  
12:14 <Denis> would be a pity to loose the flexibility not to have the extension  
12:15 <tmortagne> mflorea: by the way it means the ckeditor extension is now unusable in < 7.1 ?  
12:15 <mflorea> yep, I'd like to be able to not specify the extension  
12:15 <Denis> if you use require-css for example, you need to define ressource twice  
12:15 <Denis> without extension you may share the same resource  
12:15 <mflorea> tmortagne, see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CKEditor+Integration#HCompatibility  
12:16 <tmortagne> mflorea: ok but even if it's documented it's not very nice :)  
12:16 <mflorea> I don't understand  
12:16 <Denis> there is other extension that will be broken as well  
12:17 <tmortagne> mflorea: impossible to try last version of the extension in < 7.1 is not very nice  
12:17 <Denis> what is annoying is that it is not easy to make them compatible with both, so you need to maintain 2 version of the same extension  
12:17 <tmortagne> yes so we need to fix this regression  
12:17 <Denis> but there is no easy way out  
12:18 <mflorea> sure, but you have an option. If you want the cutting edge you should try a more recent version of XWiki  
12:18 <Denis> the mistake was to have made it bad in 6.x  
12:18 <Denis> a potential solution would be to keep the compatibility function, and to provide a new one for 7.x  
12:19 <tmortagne> mflorea: a not yes released version of XWiki, great. It may be Ok for an experience extension like this one but making impossible to have an extension usable in both < 7.1 and 7.1 is a nonsense to me  
12:19 <tmortagne> s/yes releases/yet released/  
12:20 <Denis> I think having a separate function is the cleanest solution, the other alternative being to server .js.js files  
12:21 <tmortagne> Denis: need to find the new method name but yes it's probably the safest  
12:22 <mflorea> I'm more in favor to check for ".js.js" in the webjar handler  
12:22 <mflorea> with a config param to disable it  
12:22 <lucaa> has quit  
12:22 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <Denis> but with that, you will be serving .js.js files  
12:23 <mflorea> yes, is there any problem?  
12:23 <Denis> it is a bit odd for the client side  
12:23 <mflorea> as I said, with the config option to disable it  
12:23 <cjd> +1 for .js.js  
12:23 <mflorea> I find it more ugly to have two methods to get the webjar URL  
12:24 <Denis> btw, I am not sure the behavior of the require-css will be compatible  
12:24 <cjd> require-css ? we're using that?  
12:24 <Denis> from what I see, it behave differently in regards to the presence of a query string  
12:24 <mflorea> does require add the extension for css?  
12:25 <Denis> I am using that in an extension, couldn't I ?  
12:25 <cjd> someone wrote an extension to make requirejs work with css but it's a massive hack and it doesn't work in every browser  
12:26 <Denis> there is different implementation cjd, and there exists efficient ones  
12:26 <mflorea> Denis, we can serve .css.css also  
12:26 <Denis> no  
12:26 <mflorea> why?  
12:26 <cjd> http://requirejs.org/docs/faq-advanced.html#css  
12:26 <cjd> tl;dr minefield  
12:27 <Denis> what I mean is that you focus on a given use case, not sure we will solve them all  
12:27 <Denis> in regards to css, it should works without any hack actually, since it behave properly without extension and a querystring  
12:28 <cjd> I'm sure that .js.js will \*not\* solve all possible use cases, if it did then it would be a breakthrough in CS  
12:29 <cjd> my position is we need to make logical steps forward and backtrack when something doesn't work  
12:29 <Denis> what looks odd to me with .js.js is that the name will stay on client side  
12:29 <Denis> why not using a new method ?  
12:30 <cjd> hrm does that break old extensions ?  
12:30 <mflorea> I  
12:30 <mflorea> I'd rather not complicate the API  
12:30 <Denis> you keep the existing methods with a querystring, and deprecate it  
12:30 <mflorea> wdym?  
12:30 <Denis> you use a new one from now on  
12:31 <cjd> oh, I'll use the old one so that my extensions work on older xwiki :)  
12:31 <mflorea> you mean modify $services.webjars.url to return a fake query string?  
12:31 <Denis> I mean, you ensure the URL with the old method always has a querystring, and you provide a new one without that hack  
12:31 <mflorea> and add new method. Wouldn't the fake qs be strange too like the .js.js?  
12:31 <mflorea> I don't see how the fake qs is different from the .js.js  
12:32 <mflorea> both a strange  
12:32 <mflorea> both stay on the client  
12:32 <cjd> I like .js.js because there are a lot of ways to screw up with requirejs and that smooths them all over  
12:32 <cjd> "do what I mean"  
12:33 <Denis> cjd: or hide stupid usage and potential issue  
12:33 <mflorea> cjd: it will work only for require+webjar  
12:34 <mflorea> another option  
12:35 <mflorea> in the $services.webjars.url we test if the path ends with .js . Yes -> add a fake qs. No -> leave it like that  
12:35 <mflorea> wdyt?  
12:35 <Denis> what about stripping the extension from the argument ?  
12:36 <mflorea> you still need to pass it if the resource is evaluated  
12:36 <mflorea> (in which care there is a qs)  
12:36 <mflorea> but yes  
12:36 <cjd> 12:31 <+Denis> cjd: or hide stupid usage and potential issue  <-- ADA dies, Javascript thrives, note the trend...  
12:37 <mflorea> we could do like this: ends with .js? Yes -> remove .js if no extra params (=qs). No -> add .js if extra params (qs)  
12:38 <mflorea> this way the API is more robust  
12:38 <mflorea> actually no  
12:38 <mflorea> we can't remove the .js  
12:38 <mflorea> because we don't know if the URL will be used with requirejs  
12:38 <mflorea> adding an extra fake qs is not a problem  
12:39 <mflorea> removing the extension is a problem if you don't use the URL with require  
12:39 <mflorea> so the solution remains:  
12:39 <mflorea> (13:35:07) mflorea: in the $services.webjars.url we test if the path ends with .js . Yes -> add a fake qs. No -> leave it like that  
12:42 <mflorea> Denis: is this ok with you?  
13:06 <Denis> mflorea: let try that, with good documentation and cross fingers we do not have any unforseen effects  
13:06 <mflorea> ok, committing  
13:06 <vmassol> thanks mflorea  
13:08 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <martinus\_\_> has quit  
13:29 <lucaa> has quit  
13:33 <OSIMasson> has quit  
13:41 <abusenius> has quit  
13:41 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:44 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok if I add a constructor for DocumentReference: public DocumentReference(String wikiName, List<String> spaceNames, String pageName) ?  
13:54 <vmassol> (tmortagne and all)  
13:57 <vmassol> nevermind you've added it already, I was not up to date :)  
13:58 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <tmortagne> vmassol: I did not, this constructor always been there as far as I can see  
13:58 <vmassol> ah ok cool  
13:58 <vmassol> :)  
13:58 <tmortagne> reference are designed for multiple spaces from the start  
13:58 <vmassol> I know but I didn't think we had it… ;)  
14:07 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: fyi your skype seems to be stopped (don't know if it's intentional ;))  
15:23 <tmortagne> indeed looks like it crashed  
15:24 <msmeria> has quit  
15:32 <OSIMasson> has quit  
15:36 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <Trefex> so...  
15:43 <Trefex> created a new sub-wiki  
15:43 <Trefex> and Installing document [https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/view/Main/ » https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/view/Main/ » https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/view/Main/SolrLocaleFacet]  
15:43 <Trefex> it is stuck on doing this since 30 mins  
15:56 <ClemensR> @Trefex: sometimes it is just the browser ... I am not sure if you can just reload the page with the  current installer. You could try to login into the new subwiki and check the document index if new pages are curently created  
16:19 <tmortagne> ClemensR, Trefex: the installe just display a status running on the server so you can always refresh the page  
16:20 <tmortagne> hmm actually that's true for extension installer and distribution wizard, not so sure about wiki creation  
16:20 <tmortagne> it does display something running on server side but not sure how it will react to reloading the page  
16:29 <Trefex> tmortagne: omg  
16:29 <Trefex> will i ever get this thing to run?  
16:31 <Trefex> is it ok to use this? http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Filesystem+Attachment+Porter  
16:33 <tmortagne> Trefex: this usually the thing to use AFAIK yes (but never used it myself)  
16:33 <Trefex> btw fixed the issue with the missing admin icons  
16:33 <tmortagne> but generally you use it right after you move to filesystem attachments  
16:33 <Trefex> yeah  
16:33 <Trefex> my wiki is still empty  
16:35 <OSIMasson> has quit  
16:36 <Trefex> created a new sub-wiki and now it hands at ColorThemes >> WebHome  
16:36 <Trefex> seems i can't create a sub-wiki  
16:49 <gsmeria> has quit  
16:50 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
16:52 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
16:55 <ClemensR> can you see that subwiki in the wiki-index (just use another browser tab)

18:30 <Trefex> Here is what I do  
18:30 <Trefex> Disable "view" on XWikiAllGroup  
18:31 <Trefex> Add global user to group "ViewGroup"  
18:31 <Trefex> give group "ViewGroup" the "view" permission  
18:31 <Denis> please try to thing your policy by allowing right, not denying them  
18:31 <Trefex> then, the user will not see anything in the subwiki

18:55 <vmassol> the most powerful one  
18:55 <vmassol> :)

19:03 <Trefex> xwikiorg\_guest\_3: problem solved  
19:03 <Trefex> i want my 5$ :P  
19:03 <Trefex> xwikiorg\_guest\_3: create a local group, add the user  
19:04 <Trefex> in the groups permission, remove all ticks from all scopes in the "view" column  
19:04 <Trefex> and only "green tick" the view column for the new group  
19:04 <Trefex> done  
19:04 <xwikiorg\_guest\_3> Remove all ticks from all groups in all scopes?  
19:04 <xwikiorg\_guest\_3> or just that one group?  
19:04 <Trefex> it seems that putting 1 group green implies that all other groups will be denied  
19:04 <xwikiorg\_guest\_3> oh  
19:04 <Trefex> all groups, all scopes  
19:05 <Trefex> however Deny >>>>>> allow  
19:05 <Trefex> so anything in deny will overwrite anything else in any other group  
19:05 <Trefex> so simply, have everything "white", and making 1 group green results in all groups denied except the green group  
19:05 <Trefex> makes sense, is not documented anywhere, but it works :P  
19:06 <xwikiorg\_guest\_3> That seemed to do it. I'm blown away at how quick you all jumped on that for improving usability
